algorithm_technique: Iterate from right to left, handling carry; prepend 1 if all are 9s
Convert to integer, add one, convert back to list (less efficient for very large numbers)
problem_summary_simple: Increment a large integer represented as an array of digits by one.
problem_summary_technical: Simulates manual addition with carry-over from right to left, handling the case of all 9s.
key_insights: The most straightforward approach is to simulate manual addition, starting from the least significant digit.
A carry variable is essential to propagate the increment.
The edge case where all digits are 9 requires expanding the array.
Converting the array to an integer, performing addition, and converting back is conceptually simple.
However, this approach can lead to overflow issues for extremely large integers if not handled carefully (e.g., using arbitrary-precision arithmetic).
The provided Python solution for the second approach handles large numbers implicitly.
